body:
I have the following in compilers.yaml

```
compilers:
- compiler:
    modules: []
    operating_system: centos7
    paths:
      cc: /usr/bin/gcc
      cxx: /usr/bin/g++
      f77: /usr/bin/gfortran
      fc: /usr/bin/gfortran
    spec: gcc@4.8.5
- compiler:
    modules: []
    operating_system: centos7
    paths:
      cc: /home/gjohnson/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-6.1.0-u2wxtnirnnygyyozth2ylds56sbdnm5a/bin/gcc
      cxx: /home/gjohnson/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-6.1.0-u2wxtnirnnygyyozth2ylds56sbdnm5a/bin/g++
      f77: /home/gjohnson/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-6.1.0-u2wxtnirnnygyyozth2ylds56sbdnm5a/bin/gfortran
      fc: /home/gjohnson/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-6.1.0-u2wxtnirnnygyyozth2ylds56sbdnm5a/bin/gfortran
      cflags: -march=native
      fflags: -march=native
      cxxflags: -march=native
    spec: gcc@6.1.0
```

However, I do not see any evidence that things built with gcc@6.1.0 are using the flags values.

```
spec:
- ncurses:
    arch:
      platform: linux
      platform_os: centos7
      target: x86_64
    compiler:
      name: gcc
      version: 6.1.0
    hash: fmqjxbzwxst76zjvhxcxs227jliyidnl
    namespace: builtin
    parameters:
      cflags: []
      cppflags: []
      cxxflags: []
      fflags: []
      ldflags: []
      ldlibs: []
    version: '6.0'
```
title: does cflags work in compilers.yaml
